docs.abstract: A new national service program is working to get kids smarter about good eating.
docs.snippet: A new national service program is working to get kids smarter about good eating.

docs.abstract: A new national service program is working to get kids smarter about good eating.
docs.lead_paragraph: FoodCorps, which started last week, is symbolic of just what we need: a national service program that aims to improve nutrition education for children, develop school gardening projects and change what's being served on school lunch trays.
docs.snippet: A new national service program is working to get kids smarter about good eating.

headline.seo: W. B. Kannel, Who Led Historic Heart Study, Dies at 87
headline.print_headline: W. B. Kannel Dies, 87; Led Heart Study
headline.main: W. B. Kannel, Who Led Historic Heart Study, Dies at 87

docs.abstract: William B Kannel, cardiovascular epidemiologist who led innovative research into heart attacks, dies at age 87.
docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Kannel was one of the principal researchers behind the life-changing Framingham Heart Study, which began in 1948 and continues today.
docs.snippet: Dr. Kannel was one of the principal researchers behind the life-changing Framingham Heart Study, which began in 1948 and continues today.

headline.main: Patterns: Mothers' Weight Tied to Youths' Asthma

docs.abstract: Study published in The Journal of Epidemiology & Community Health finds women who are overweight or obese when they become pregnant may be more likely to have children who develop asthma as teenagers. (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: Women who are overweight or obese when they become pregnant may be more likely to have children who develop asthma as teenagers, new research shows. The findings could point to yet another consequence of the rising rates of obesity worldwide. Scientists have already documented a number of complications that are more likely to arise in women who are obese before they become pregnant, among them a greater risk of stillbirths, preterm deliveries and gestational hypertension.
docs.snippet: Women who are overweight or obese when they become pregnant may be more likely to have children who develop asthma as teenagers, new research shows.     The findings could point to yet another consequence of the rising rates of obesity worldwide....

headline.print_headline: Preaching a Healthy Diet in the Deep-Fried Delta
headline.main: Preaching a Healthy Diet in the Deep-Fried Delta

docs.lead_paragraph: In the Mississippi Delta, the Rev. Michael O. Minor is waging war against obesity and bad health, and the National Baptist Convention has taken up his campaign.
